planning.prep_time: PT20 minutes, plus cooling and chillingM

ingredients.item: 1 large leek, white part only, washed and finely sliced
250g potatoes, washed and cut into 5mm cubes
1 large carrot, peeled and cut into 5mm cubes
2 medium Waitrose British Blacktail Free Range Egg yolks

instructions.step: Heat the oil in a frying pan over a low heat.  Add the leek, garlic, thyme and rosemary and cook gently for 3-4 minutes until softened.  Increase the heat slightly, add the potatoes and carrot and fry for a further 5-6 minutes until softened.  Pour in the cream, stir to combine and set aside to cool completely. Stir the cheese into the cooled vegetable mixture and season to taste.  Dust the work surface with flour and roll out the pastry a little thinner than a £1 coin.  Using a 12cm plain round cutter or small bowl, cut out 8 discs.  Divide the filling between them, placing it into the centre of each one.  Mix together the egg yolks and milk to make a glaze, then brush the edges of the pastry. Fold the pastry over the filling, pinch and crimp to seal then place on a non-stick baking sheet.  Glaze the tops then chill for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 180°C, gas mark 4.  Bake the pasties for 35-40 minutes until golden then transfer to a wire rack to cool for 10 minutes before serving.
